entry.title: Agile manifesto failure
entry.content:
My favourite part here is: “Working software over comprehensive documentation.” People often interpret this as “We don’t need documentation, we need working software,” which can lead to a situation where they end up with neither documentation nor working software. When a new developer comes along and asks, “Where’s the documentation I can quickly review?” they are usually pointed back to that initial quote, with the added comment, “We are agile”. This demonstrates how the meaning of highly compressed quotes can be blindly extracted, often leading to a completely different, almost opposite interpretation.

Discussion on LinkedIn

entry.title: Why big company experience doesn’t always translate to practical skills

link.title: Why big company experience doesn't always translate to practical skills

entry.content:
Many think they will work for big companies to gain experience, but they don’t realize that this experience involves solving problems that don’t exist outside of the big company. That experience will not help you do real work "in the field". This is also a pattern that brings various technologies into smaller businesses that have no clue why they need them. They propose using these technologies without understanding that they were designed to solve specific problems that only exist at certain scales.

Discussion on LinkedIn

Got a recommendation on this subject in this thread, the book “Siliconned” by Emmanuel Maggori. Will be on my bookshelf soon.

entry.title: In memory of Terry Davis
entry.content:
In memory of Terry Davis (December 15, 1969 – August 11, 2018)

Terry Davis - "Smartest programmer that ever lived"
YouTube TempleOS

Terry A. Davis was a singular figure in the world of software development, known for creating TempleOS, a highly unconventional operating system that he developed entirely by himself. Davis was both a brilliant programmer and a deeply troubled individual, battling schizophrenia throughout much of his life, which heavily influenced both his work and his worldview.

TempleOS was Davis’ magnum opus, a 64-bit operating system with a unique vision. Designed to be a modern-day temple where God could communicate with humans, it featured a deliberately limited resolution of 640x480 and a text-based interface with a custom programming language, HolyC, which Davis also wrote from scratch. The system was lightweight, with its design focused on simplicity, speed, and direct communication with hardware, breaking away from modern OS standards. Despite being rough around the edges, TempleOS was a testament to Davis’ raw talent and determination.

Davis’ creation, however, was deeply intertwined with his mental health struggles. His schizophrenia led him to believe that God was directly guiding his work, and much of TempleOS’s structure and aesthetic choices reflected his religious visions. Although many in the tech community found his work difficult to categorize, it was impossible not to recognize the genius behind it.

Terry Davis’ life and work have sparked conversations about mental health in the tech world. He demonstrated the vast potential of a lone programmer driven by passion and belief, yet his story also highlighted the profound challenges of working with untreated mental illness.

He passed away on 11 of August in 2018 (was hit by train), but his legacy continues to resonate with programmers and creators, serving as a reminder of the complexity of human genius and the fine line between creativity and struggle. TempleOS, though niche, remains a fascinating relic of one man’s uncompromising vision.

Materials

  • TempleOS - The TempleOS
  • TempleOS source code - The TempleOS source code
  • HolyC programming language - programming language that Terry Davis invented to write TempleOS
  • Srine - fork of TemplateOS with Networking, and other stuff
  • ZealOS - Another work with enchancements

  • TinkerOS - another fork

  • A personal campaign sponsored by Family and Friends of Terry Donations to Research

  • Find a Grave
  • Terry Davis Linkedin Tribute

Good videos with covering his story

  • The Schizophrenic Genius - Terry A. Davis Story - the good coverage of Terrys story
  • The Apostles Keeping TEMPLEOS Alive… - talks about the details and forks of the Temple OS

In the memory of Terry Davis

entry.title: WARNING: Scam attempt
entry.content:
Be aware of this chinese domain scam attempt. They want you to pay for their zone domains within same name.

How the Scam Works:

  1. Initial Contact: Scammers send an email to a company, claiming to be from a domain registration service in China. They state that another company is attempting to register a domain name that matches the recipient’s business name.

  2. Urgency and Fear: The email usually creates a sense of urgency by implying that if the recipient doesn’t act quickly, they might lose control over their brand name or trademarks in China.

  3. Domain Registration Offer: To resolve the issue, the scammer offers to help the recipient register the domain names themselves, often at inflated prices. Sometimes, they suggest that by paying a fee, the recipient can prevent the other company from registering the domain.

  4. No Real Threat: In reality, there is no company attempting to register these domains, and the whole situation is fabricated. The goal is to trick the recipient into paying for unnecessary domain registrations.

What to Do:

  • Ignore the Email: If you receive such an email, it’s best to ignore it and not respond. Engaging with the scammers can lead to more persistent attempts to deceive you.
  • Report It: You can report the email to your IT department or a relevant authority to help raise awareness about the scam.
  • Educate Your Team: Make sure that your colleagues, especially those in decision-making roles, are aware of this scam to prevent them from falling for it.

If you’re ever in doubt about a domain-related issue, it’s always a good idea to consult with a trusted domain registrar or legal professional before taking any action.

References:

  • https://steigerlegal.ch/2019/06/14/warnung-china-schwindel-domainnamen-2019/
  • https://community.cloudflare.com/t/a-chinese-company-is-trying-to-register-my-website-domain-name-for-their-client/583416

entry.title: Lion’s gate
entry.content:
“Lion’s Gate” typically refers to an astrological event that occurs every year around August 8th. It is believed to be a time of heightened cosmic energy, with its origins rooted in ancient Egyptian and cosmic symbolism.

Key Aspects of the Lion’s Gate:

  1. Timing:
    • The Lion’s Gate portal opens between July 26th and August 12th, peaking on August 8th.
    • This period coincides with the astrological sign of Leo, symbolized by the lion, which is known for its association with strength, courage, and power.
  2. Cosmic Alignment:
    • The Lion’s Gate is marked by the alignment of the Earth, the star Sirius, and the Sun. Sirius, the brightest star in the sky, is often associated with abundance, prosperity, and spiritual growth.
    • As Sirius rises in the sky (in alignment with the Sun), it is believed to be a time when powerful energies flow between the physical and spiritual realms.
  3. Spiritual Significance:
    • The Lion’s Gate is seen as a powerful time for spiritual awakening, transformation, and manifestation.
    • It’s a period when individuals are encouraged to focus on their goals, release past negativity, and embrace new beginnings. The energy is said to support personal and collective growth, helping to manifest dreams and desires into reality.
  4. Numerology:
    • August 8th (8/8) is significant in numerology. The number 8 is associated with infinity, balance, and the manifestation of material and spiritual wealth. The repetition of the number on this date is believed to amplify these energies.
  5. Meditation and Rituals:
    • Many people engage in meditation, rituals, and spiritual practices during the Lion’s Gate to harness the energy for personal growth, healing, and manifestation. This may include setting intentions, visualizing goals, or simply being open to receiving guidance and inspiration.

In essence, the Lion’s Gate is a period of cosmic alignment and spiritual opportunity, offering a potent time for transformation and empowerment.
